name: Waimea Canyon
description: Known as the 'Grand Canyon of the Pacific,' it offers spectacular views of deep valleys and colorful cliffs.
tips: Bring water and sunscreen, visit in the morning to avoid fog.

name: Nā Pali Coast
description: Dramatic coastline accessible by boat, helicopter, or hiking. Famous for green cliffs and secluded beaches.
tips: Book tours in advance; Kalalau Trail requires a permit.

name: Hanalei Bay
description: Crescent-shaped bay with calm waters in summer and strong waves in winter.
tips: Good for beginner surfing in summer; parking fills up fast.

name: Wailua Falls
description: 26-meter waterfall visible from the road, famous from the 'Fantasy Island' TV opening.
tips: Quick visit; ideal to combine with other Wailua attractions.

name: Poipu Beach
description: Reef-protected beach, ideal for families, snorkeling, and spotting Hawaiian monk seals.

name: Kokeʻe State Park
description: Mountainous park with dozens of trails and views of the Nā Pali Coast.
tips: Weather changes quickly; bring a rain jacket.

name: Allerton Garden
description: Tropical garden with giant fig trees and film sets from Jurassic Park.
tips: Guided tours required; book in advance.

name: Spouting Horn
description: A reef blowhole that shoots water spectacularly when waves enter.
tips: Best in late afternoon; great quick stop after Poipu Beach.

name: Kilauea Lighthouse
description: Historic lighthouse on a dramatic cliff, surrounded by protected seabirds.
tips: Bring binoculars for birdwatching; great for photos.

name: Queen’s Bath
description: Tidal pool formed in lava rock. Beautiful but dangerous in high tides.
tips: Visit only at low tide; check safety conditions first.
